narrative.title: Western Desert Force - 1940Q4
narrative.situation: British combined_arms_corps deployed in North Africa during 1940Q4.
narrative.objectives: Execution of Operation Compass - British counter-offensive to expel Italian 10th Army from Egypt and advance into Libya. First major British offensive of WWII.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

supply.notes: Operational tempo during Operation Compass - supply lines stretched during rapid advance. Initial 5-day raid planning extended to 2-month campaign. Advanced supply dumps established before offensive. Water critical in desert operations.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Combined arms mobile warfare coordination (armor, infantry, artillery)
Deep reconnaissance and intelligence gathering (11th Hussars screening operations)
Night movement and navigation in trackless desert terrain
Infantry-tank cooperation tactics (Matildas supporting Indian infantry)
Minimal logistics operational capability (extended 5-day raid into 2-month campaign)

supply_states.notes: Operational tempo during Operation Compass - supply lines stretched during rapid advance. Initial 5-day raid planning extended to 2-month campaign. Advanced supply dumps established before offensive. Water critical in desert operations.
